box2D.dynamics.joints.B2WeldJointDef

type
class
extends
B2JointDef
Weld joint definition. You need to specify local anchor points where they are attached and the relative body angle. The position of the anchor points is important for computing the reaction torque.

Constructor

new()

Instance Variables hide inherited show inherited

bodyA : box2D.dynamics.B2Body

inherited from box2D.dynamics.joints.B2JointDef
The first attached body.

bodyB : box2D.dynamics.B2Body

inherited from box2D.dynamics.joints.B2JointDef
The second attached body.

collideConnected : Bool

inherited from box2D.dynamics.joints.B2JointDef
Set this flag to true if the attached bodies should collide.

localAnchorA : box2D.common.math.B2Vec2

The local anchor point relative to bodyA's origin.

localAnchorB : box2D.common.math.B2Vec2

The local anchor point relative to bodyB's origin.

referenceAngle : Float

The body2 angle minus body1 angle in the reference state (radians).

type : Int

inherited from box2D.dynamics.joints.B2JointDef
The joint type is set automatically for concrete joint types.

userData : Dynamic

inherited from box2D.dynamics.joints.B2JointDef
Use this to attach application specific data to your joints.

Initialize the bodies, anchors, axis, and reference angle using the world anchor and world axis.
